com.joliciel.talismane.parser

Class TransitionBasedParser

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.joliciel.talismane.parser.TransitionBasedParser
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    NonDeterministicParser, Parser

    public class TransitionBasedParser
extends java.lang.Object
implements NonDeterministicParser
    A non-deterministic parser implementing transition based parsing, using a Shift-Reduce algorithm.
    See Nivre 2008 for details on the algorithm for the deterministic case.
    Author:
    Assaf Urieli

    • Nested Class Summary

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from interface com.joliciel.talismane.parser.Parser

        public java.util.List<ParseConfiguration> parseSentence(java.util.List<PosTagSequence> input)
                                                 throws TalismaneException,
                                                        java.io.IOException
        Description copied from interface: NonDeterministicParser
        Analyse a list of pos-tag sequences, each of which represents one possibility of tagging a given sentence, and return the n most likely parse configurations for the sentence.
        Specified by:
        parseSentence in interface NonDeterministicParser
        Parameters:
        input - the n most likely pos-tag sequences for this sentence.
        Returns:
        the n most likely parse sequences for this sentence
        Throws:
        UnknownTransitionException - if an attempt is made to apply an unknown transition
        UnknownDependencyLabelException - if an attempt is made to apply an unknown label
        CircularDependencyException - if an attempt is made to generate a circular dependency
        InvalidTransitionException - if a transition is applied without meeting pre-conditions
        TalismaneException

      • getMaxAnalysisTimePerSentence

        public int getMaxAnalysisTimePerSentence()
        Description copied from interface: Parser
        The maximum time alloted per sentence for parse tree analysis, in seconds. Will be ignored if set to 0. If analysis jumps out because of time-out, there will be a parse-forest instead of a parse-tree, with several nodes left unattached.
        Specified by:
        getMaxAnalysisTimePerSentence in interface Parser

      • getMinFreeMemory

        public int getMinFreeMemory()
        Description copied from interface: Parser
        The minimum amount of remaining free memory to continue a parse, in kilobytes. Will be ignored is set to 0. If analysis jumps out because of free memory descends below this limit, there will be a parse-forest instead of a parse-tree, with several nodes left unattached.
        Specified by:
        getMinFreeMemory in interface Parser
